intro: Potamogeton × fluitans proles syriacus, commonly known as the Syriac floating pondweed, is a hybrid aquatic plant native to the Middle East and parts of Europe. It is characterized by its long, narrow leaves that float on the water surface, with roots submerged in the sediment. The plant produces small, green flowers that are typically borne in spikes, and it thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. It is often found in marshes, lakes, and along the edges of rivers. Due to its rapid growth, it can become invasive in certain regions, impacting local ecosystems.
